------=_NextPart_001_4DC3_01C31ABA.0D253F90
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Gordon and Raymie,

Attached Synch.zip contains the following changes on th=
e Sync model.
-- A new SampleLinkExtractor.java added which does some preli=
minary link extraction and enqueue the links back into the frontier.
-- Sam=
pleFetcherAnalyser.java modified to use my MemPoolManager to store the down=
loaded pages. The VirtualBuffer is tagged to the CrawlURI and subsequently =
used by the LinkExtractor. ( Compiled mem pool classes present in the class=
es directory. )
-- SampleWorkerManager.java modified to do a continuous deq=
ueue.
-- So. the sync crawler now takes the seed from the file and does con=
tnuous crawl through link extraction.

I would checkin these source files i=
nto the ArchiveOpenCrawler sourceforge CVS module. ( Or should it be in Ane=
cdote ??)

Raymie : The MemPoolManager classes are still in the package org=
.archive.crawler.io only in this zip. I will convert them to st.ata.io when=
 I checkin to sourceforge.

Other things I am working on.
-- Frontier imple=
mentation : The implementation I am doing will be very similar to that of M=
ercator as mentioned in the section "A Polite and Prioritizing URL Frontier=
" of 
    ftp://gatekeeper.research.compaq.com/pub/DEC/SRC/research-reports=
/SRC-173.pdf
-- In our case, the front-end prioritizer mentioned in Mercato=
r would be a dummy single FIFO queue implementation with a proper interface=
.
-- The back-end implementation will be almost the same as Mercator.
-- I =
will send the code for it tomorrow once it settles.

The attached project s=
heet captures the new items in schedule as discussed with Gordon in the las=
t conf call.

Thanks,
Reddy


------=_NextPart_001_4DC3_01C31ABA.0D253F90
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
